thread.title: Destiny USA to celebrate 'Back to the Future Day' with movie screening, 'hoverboard' sales
thread.title_full: Destiny USA to celebrate 'Back to the Future Day' with movie screening, 'hoverboard' sales

author: Katrina Tulloch | ktulloch@syracuse.com
title: Destiny USA to celebrate 'Back to the Future Day' with movie screening, 'hoverboard' sales
text:
Destiny USA to celebrate 'Back to the Future Day' with movie screening, 'hoverboard' sales Back to the Future This 1985 file photo originally released by Universal Pictures shows Michael J. Fox as Marty McFly, left, and Christopher Lloyd as inventor Doctor Emmett Brown in a scene from the film, “Back to the Future." (The Associated Press) The "hoverboard" is on sale at Destiny USA at kiosk merchant Hero Board, located on the first level of Destiny USA by J.C. Penney. Provided photo 
SYRACUSE, N.Y. -- Destiny USA is celebrating "Back to the Future Day," on Wednesday, Oct. 21 with free valet parking for time-traveling DeLorean cars, a special Regal Cinemas screening of the iconic 1985 "Back to the Future" trilogy and "hoverboards." 
The day itself, Oct. 21, 2015, is in reference to the exact date when the film's main characters, Marty McFly and Doc Brown, travel to the future in the time-traveling DeLorean. 
'Back to the Future Day' highlights 
Free valet parking for DeLorean cars — DeLorean cars will receive free valet parking on "Back to the Future Day" at Destiny USA. Flux capacitors, while necessary for time travel, are not necessary to participate. Time travelers are reminded to abide by parking lot speed limits. Don't attempt the 88 mph needed to achieve time travel. 
Movie screening — Regal Cinemas at Destiny USA will be showing a special marathon screening of the blockbuster trilogy on Oct. 21 at 5 p.m. Tickets are available for purchase at the box office. The hoverboard is on sale at Destiny USA at kiosk merchant Hero Board, located on the first level of Destiny USA by J.C. Penney. Provided photo. 
Hoverboards — This holiday's hottest gadget, the hoverboard, is on sale at the kiosk merchant Hero Board, on the first level of Destiny USA by J.C. Penney. Note: 1.21 gigawatt batteries are not included (rechargeable lithium-ion batteries are). 
Retro music from 1985 — Tracks from the "Back to the Future" trilogy will play all day over the Destiny USA PA system, featuring tracks like "Power of Love" by Huey Lewis and the News and "Johnny B. Goode" by Mark Campbell. 
Experience time travel at WonderWorks — Mention the phrase "Back to the Future" at WonderWorks and receive "Buy One Get One" free general admission. Experience the Gyroscope at WonderWorks to feel the weightlessness and the roll-and-tumble effect associated with time travel. This offer is good on Oct. 21, 2015 only. 
Katrina Tulloch writes features and entertainment stories for Syracuse.com and The Post-Standard. Contact her: Email | Twitter | Google+
